alert.note: Alert for Boone; Fountain; Hendricks; Montgomery; Parke; Putnam (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 09 at 4:16PM EDT by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Fountain, northwestern Hendricks, northeastern Parke, southwestern Boone, southern Montgomery and northern Putnam Counties through 445 PM EDT... At 416 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 10 miles northeast of Rockville, or 15 miles southwest of Crawfordsville, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southeastern Fountain, northwestern Hendricks, northeastern Parke, southwestern Boone, southern Montgomery and northern Putnam Counties, including the following locations... North Salem, Advance, Waveland, Carpentersville, Marshall, Russellville, Groveland, Ladoga, Jamestown, and New Ross. This includes Interstate 74 between mile markers 44 and 54. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Boone; Fountain; Hendricks; Montgomery; Parke; Putnam
